column1: Lycée Georges Brassens is a senior high school/sixth-form college in Villeneuve-le-Roi
In May 2016 a teacher stated that the school had been contaminated with mold.The school closed temporarily on Wednesday 8 June 2016 due to a decision from prefectural authorities. Dominique Chauvin
column2: cosecrétaire général du syndicat national des enseignements de second degré de Créteil (Snes)
column3: stated that the campus at the time was in poor condition.In December 2017
column4: a part of the roof in a classroom of the third floor fell
column5: and the teachers decided to apply their "right of withdrawal" for asbestos suspicion. The teachers protested several times
column6: asking the Academy and the District for air tests and new buildings. This led the high school students to miss almost two months of class. After many weeks
column7: the Lycée Brassens administration decided to relocate the students in a substitution building in Vitry-Sur-Seine
